lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Awesome. A lot of really amazing community art came out of it, because you guys are ridiculous, and we'll probably see some of that at the break today. But before we kick into the game, let's get through our announcements for the evening while we also wait for Mr. Sam Riegel, Scanlan, who I think we all can consider is pretty important to tonight's events, seeing as how he's currently being digested in the belly of the dragon.

lines.name: LAURA, TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh shit!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That didn't happen.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes it did. Yes it did. No. So. Starting off our announcements for the evening: first off, I am going to be flying out bright and early tomorrow morning to A-Kon in Dallas. I'll be out there doing panels and signings with a bunch of other great guests. I understand the same weekend is also Dallas Comic Con, because what the fuck, Dallas? At which Mary and Steve are there also, so don't choose: come to both! No.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wade the waters.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And if not, go say hi to Steve and Mary, wherever that happens, in the lesser part of Dallas. I don't know if it is, I just like--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, there's a lesser part of Dallas, totally, over with the lesser-- are you guys throwing up because of how nervous you are?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What? No. Oh, my dice! Where are my dice?!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Where are your dice?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm so nervous, I don't even have my dice!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll go find them, I'll go find them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Travis is going to get them. Wow. Two weeks to stew on this and it's already falling apart.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This is the exact icy, steely demeanor that I depend on.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh my god, are they in there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: While he looks for those--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I have extras, if you need some.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I do want to also say the newest Dear Abby article series for Critical Role characters went up-- or goes up tomorrow, right?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Tomorrow, Fridays.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Friday. And whose is that one?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Who goes up next?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What? Who goes up what next?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The next Dear Abby?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, I think it's me!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: See her answering questions to various distraught people throughout the realms of Exandria, and her I'm sure very astute--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm a really good giver of advice. I learned that about myself.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It's true.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: More about quantity than quality? Maybe?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Really awesome, bringing the giants back into the world with a very fleshed-out story. I'm super excited about it, and keep tabs on that whenever that comes out, should be in the next few months, I think. I've seen some stuff behind-the-scenes and it looks really, really cool. But as part of that event yesterday, we also kicked off and announced a new video series campaign that I'm doing with the actual Wizards of the Coast Dungeons & Dragons team. Me and Chris Perkins wrote and designed together a story that I fleshed out and am running for a series of celebrity guests, one of which is our fantastic Ashley Johnson there.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Hey!

lines.name: LAURA, MARISHA
lines.text: You're a celebrity!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That was pretty great, guys. I'm not going to lie, that was pretty legit.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Just keep vamping. Keep vamping until the bard gets here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's right, we're waiting on Scanlan to get here. Other guests include Utkarsh, Shelby, Jonah-- I wrote all the first names down because the last names, some of them were hard to pronounce, but you can look up the actual announcements to get the full names. I'm really bad at this. It's been two weeks, give me a break.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You're busy. You're busy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nah! I've got so much free time. But it's going to be a great group, and I look forward to announcing it soon on when those will begin to air throughout the summer, because it's going to be a lot of fun. And I get to play in Forgotten Realms, which is something I've wanted to do again for a long time, and hope I don't mess up all the existing fantastic lore that Ed Greenwood has developed since he-- oh, are you okay, Laura?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, I really feel like I'm going to throw up.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: There's literally up-chuck going to happen. Just do it in a little thing and I'll feed it back to you like a little bird

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Just go in there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (retching noise) I threw up so many dice!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll talk about our sponsor this week.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So Travis, you want to take it away?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Our amazing sponsor this week is Backblaze. Backblaze is an amazing, unlimited cloud backup company for your Mac and PC, for just five dollars a month, it's incredible. We have an amazing representative from Backblaze in the studio. He's a crazy, crazy uber-fan. Yev, wave to me baby, blow me a kiss. He's incredible.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You should check out his Twitter page because he has printed out Flat Mercer and he's chronicling his adventures, and I'm pretty proud of it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes! We're on you, we're talking about Backblaze right now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, please continue, we're not stopping you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Guys, no shit, I just installed it yesterday on my home computer. It's currently backing up right now. It's an online file backup system for all your stuff. Your documents, your media, your Critical Role fanart, your videos of Scanlan singing things. There's no gimmicks or additional charges, it's just five dollars a month, and! You don't want to go to Backblaze.com, you want to go to backblaze.com/criticalrole, where you can get a fully-featured 15-day trial.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How many days, Sam?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 15 days, free! If you like it, keep getting it, pay five bucks a month, that's nothing. Or if you don't, whatever, it doesn't bother me. But it's only for Critters, and also if you go to backblaze.com/criticalrole right now, you'll see pictures of us, quotes from us. It's actually really cute.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, it was pretty cute.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And I am such a supporter of these guys that I even wrote a song for them.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's very short. Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Please, go ahead.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I need a drink now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You did good Sam, you did good.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There's some Guinness in the fridge.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's been cool having sponsors come to the show, partially because they all come to us from being fans of the actual show, and that's the driving force behind this, so we want to make sure that things are on-brand from people who are genuinely interested in our community and have things to offer that'll be useful. I can say this as I have a web series I directed many years ago and spent a whole year doing, I lost all the files because of the hard drive that I had-- the external hard drive failed, and I don't have any of those anymore. And so since then I've been very, very careful about backing everything up. So this service would have been really helpful back then. So don't make the same mistakes I did. There Will Be Brawl only lives as final video files. It kills me. I couldn't even fix stuff. Still have the watermark on the last three videos for the Escapist that I can't remove. Anyway. Learn from my mistakes. So! Do we have anything else any of you folks want to announce?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: E3's next week!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: E3 is next week.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh wait, no it's not. It's two weeks from now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, it's two weeks from now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's two weeks from now. I'm sorry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I believe nothing coming out of that mouth now!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: E3 is two weeks from now, and I'm also going to be at Amazing Comic Con Vegas two weeks from now. And Signal Boost is currently in its second week, which is hilarious, and amazing, and you should totally check it out because it's weird.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. You're like the most interesting man in the world.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's fantastic.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I've always thought that about you, Taliesin.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No you're not!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Pike's got us covered. Right, Pike?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, great. So, without further ado, and no further delaying the inevitable--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You got a little something on your--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Little thing on my nose, right there?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You might need to go the bathroom, check it out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So. Continuing where we left off two weeks ago. The intrepid party of adventurers known as Vox Machina, after recently freeing the town of Westruun from being occupied and ruled by the roving Herd of the Storm, which Grog once hailed from, cut down their brutal leader Kevdak and temporarily restored power to a combination of himself and Kevdak's son, Zanror. An accord was made between the two of you to agree to go after and destroy the ancient black dragon Umbrasyl, a member of the Chroma Conclave, and marked for you to eventually destroy anyway, but who had currently made a deal with the Herd in exchange for goods, gold, and ruling over the town, would let them live and be essentially undisturbed, seemingly. You gathered an army, you forged a plan, and an ambush was set for the next time the dragon swooped down from atop the mountain Gatshadow to retrieve its package. At this time, the trap was sprung, the dragon held fast by hooks and chains, a giant metallic trap designed and orchestrated by Percival, and everything was going great. The dragon had sustained quite a bit of damage and seemed to be in a rough place until it broke free and left much of the Herd fallen, dissolving and screaming. Also, Scanlan and Vax Dimension Door'd into the inside of the dragon and have spent a number of rounds now deciding how to get out of it maybe?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Tiny Vax. Tiny Vax.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You managed to go ahead and put in an Immovable Rod within its stomach, which held it up for a moment before it decided to truly gain the advantage it needed to escape the circumstance, allowed it to tear through its body, as well as an arrow that was shot by Vex towards her brother, in hopes of-- I don't know, being a signal of hope or to put him out of his misery? I'm still trying to figure it out. At this point in time, Umbrasyl took to the sky and began to coast off towards Gatshadow, seemingly the domain that it's carved for itself in this region. On its way out, Grog had thrown his newly acquired Bloodaxe and his Chain of Returning into the dragon, left it, and is now being dragged behind it now, dangling as it flies off. And that, my friends, is where we kick back into the story.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So we have, as you guys-- Grog, your feet leave the ground as you swing forward, unable by the momentum pushing forward to keep up with the sheer speed of this dragon and its size, its mass, its full stretched wings, it is far faster than any of you expected and it whooshes off towards the mountaintop. You, just looking behind as the ground just fades further and further away. The rest of you, Vox Machina, seeing this happen, see essentially half of your friends, your party, only one of them visible, now beyond your reach. With that being said, for this circumstance, let's pick up where we were on the initiative order between you three.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Just straight into it!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm ready.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We left at the right time for that, guys.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Here, how about this? Because I can't find the original initiative order, we'll just say for this circumstance we'll roll initiative based on what action's going to happen here. So we're going to have you three roll initiative.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Come on, lucky dice. I get advantage on that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I got 12.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: 13 also.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh jeez.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Starting off right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "These foul creatures. Get out of me!" (straining sound) I need you guys to both roll strength saving throws right now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's trying to puke you up?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Or just crush us.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Strength saving? Nine.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, not great. 15.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15. You manage to put your arms against the side, and using whatever forceful arcane cantrips to keep the walls at bay before it actually finds you, and you slip out in time. You, however, do suffer six points of bludgeoning damage as the muscles once again tense against you. Umbrasyl is very much aware that there are now living things inside the stomach squirming around and as the muscles relax, the voice just growls again, "Try all you want. Don't worry. I can eat you now or later."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can't hear you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So. We had two 13s and a--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 12. All right. So Grog, Vax, what are you guys doing?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm taking--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The Bramblewood is now beneath you, you're heading towards the mountain, you can see the edge of the forest now.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Maybe I go first, just in case something--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, go for it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The Bramblewood? I'm holding on, right? With the Titanstone Knuckles. Whereabouts is the axe lodged? Can I see where the chain is attached to?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can see it curving up ahead of you and with how high the sun is in the sky, it's around noon, there's a heavy bit of shadow, and at this distance? Make a perception check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Minus-- zero. 13.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 13. It seems to be somewhere around the base of the tail, like where the tail meets the rest of the actual body itself, the torso area.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's in his butt.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, it's not quite in his butt, it's more in his side.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How high am I?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Looking down? Numbers are hard for you to pick up. It's a long way.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: A long way.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a long way. Like-- yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well. Only one way to go. And that's up. I would like to try and pull myself up the chain towards Umbrasyl.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Go ahead and make an athletics check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Athletics or strength?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Athletics. Which is better, technically.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's a strength saving thing, so--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, it's strength plus your proficiency bonus.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh! I get an advantage or?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You get your proficiency bonus. You're no longer raging, because this is more fear-struck at this point.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, 14 plus five-- 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 19, yeah. You begin to ascend the chain. You get closer to it, and you can now see the axe itself is embedded and is starting to wiggle and pull out. So you're making your way up the chain with the full round at this point, you're almost to it, but that's going to be the rest of your action this turn.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, okay!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So what are you doing?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm taking the dragon sword and I am shoving it along the angle of the arrow that's coming in toward it, to try to go parallel.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. The arrowhead is still poking through--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Through, and I'm sending it along that line.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, okay. All right. Go ahead and make a general dexterity check. To see if you're able to--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Using the essence of where the actual shaft of the arrow has pierced the hide and is stuck through, you take the blade and use your understanding of precision weapons and implements to find the slight opening. And the blade thankfully is very thin. Slide it through with minimal resistance. You can see the muscles are still pushing against it, but the already preset wound from the arrow does guide it through, and you manage to go straight to the hilt, and it's found its way all the way through the wound. No additional damage is dealt necessarily, but it has gone--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This does not count as an attack on the creature?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You said you wanted to put it through an existing hole.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The hole is this thick.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Whatever you want.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Do you want to roll an attack for this?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes, I want it to be an attack.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right, now you would make the attack as the blade. The idea being that you wanted to guide it through the hole.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to use one of my Lucks. I've got two left. Better.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Didn't you use any Luck for the battle?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I used one last time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right, so you have two left.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 12 plus strength, which is low, is 14. The dragon sword-- is the dragon sword plus anything, guys? I don't know that I have the--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Plus one.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Plus one. All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, and then it does additional damage against dragons.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, and I have to roll-- I'll just say I missed. For my bonus action, I'm going to slide the dagger up along the same line and try to widen that gap.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. This roll will be at disadvantage.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The last one was too, which is why I just scrubbed it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right, right, right. Go ahead and make the secondary attack.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. Okay, so, the blade is in there and it has found its way through the existing wound, but you don't quite have the strength to actually wrench it enough to do any real, serious damage as it is a very, very hardy and well-defended creature from its natural mass. The fleshy interior of a dragon is almost as dense and as protected as the armored hide on the outside, and that's one thing you weren't counting on when entering its form.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And what did I just do, though, with the dragon sword, did I widen the hole?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You've put the blade through the hole and so now you have that blade lodged in, you can then use that to try and widen it in successive turns in itself and that will prevent you from having disadvantage on the attacks with that blade going forward, because it's already in a soft place and you can just wedge it, but it's going to be a strength attack for each of those rounds. The dagger unfortunately, you just can't find any purchase at that point there in the time given, because of the movement and the squishing. You do also suffer an additional seven points of crushing damage.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay, and I forgot. One other thing I want to do-- I have movement too, can I use my legs to push as hard as I can forward a foot or something? I know with movement over difficult terrain it's halved, and I'm in the most difficult terrain.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You are in the most difficult terrain there probably is.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But if I use my movement could I shove and go like a foot towards the outside, half a foot or anything?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pushing towards the wound?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Pushing in. Using my legs to go--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. I would say that would be part of your attack next round. Actual movement within, you would be able to move a few feet but you'd have to release the blade to do so. Any actual blade pushing forward would be your next action, so hold off for the next round. Scanlan, what you got?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oi. So I'm in a beast. As we all know, intestines are my favoured terrain-- (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I remember him saying that years ago!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is true!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Back when we first made these characters, I remember you saying that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So I held up that rod, clicked it, and then it was pulled out of the body pretty close to where I am right now. When it went, did I see air? Did I see daylight, when it went out of there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It was very small. It's the equivalent of a bullet going through, because the rod when it punched through it didn't-- it's a very thin, elongated object, so it pierced through like a metal rod at a very high speed.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So the dragon got very lucky and it went through like that, and not like that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If it would have hit-- at whatever angle it would be, even then, it's only that wide and it would still puncture a tiny slit, and due to the density of both the muscles of the creature and its body, it took damage and there's a little bit of blood coming from the wound, you imagine, but it's not like it's going to leave an open, cavernous hole.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's a cut.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, it's a cut.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Got it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But you did see where it (tearing noise) through.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And when it went out, I didn't see any daylight or anything. Just disappeared.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You just saw it (tearing noise) through the creature's stomach. You do see a little bit of blood beginning to pour out of where the wound was.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. Oh boy.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do it, baby.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't know, I got nothing. All right, I'll just try something and we'll see if it works and then I'll try something else next time. I won't die in one round, right? I'm going to Polymorph into a Tri-- not-a-ceratops. Into a small, poisonous snake.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And I'm going to go straight into that wound.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, well, before that happens you do take four points of acid damage from the stomach before you take the form, because that would be the top of the round. So, at which point you turn into a small poisonous snake, now floating amongst the acids, and find your way along the surface. And you're heading towards the wound?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going into the wound.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, all right--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: With a swim speed of 30!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Let me check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But I don't know if it's swimming, it's more squeezing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And that's going to be more of a strength-based element. So that being the case here, a poisonous snake, I'm going to need you to go ahead and roll a strength check to push against the wound.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure, man. This is a strong snake.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Really?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Which, just as a heads up, is a minus four to its strength, so that's technically a negative three.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (bink) Going well, guys!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Why don't you bite it, dude?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh yeah! Sure, I'll take a bite.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Poisonous bite.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure, go for it. Roll for an attack.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 14 plus-- I have no idea.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Plus five.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hey! That's a 19. That doesn't hit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A 19? The inside of the stomach is not as well-armored as outer parts of the body. A 19 would hit. Go ahead and roll damage.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What do I roll?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Guys, we knocked it down a point!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And it has to make a constitution saving throw versus your poison. That's an eight plus 14, at a DC of ten. So yeah, it doesn't take any additional-- oh, it takes half damage. So go ahead and roll 2d4.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ooh! Seven.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Top of the round. Okay, so, Umbrasyl is still flying up, looking down at its form, is glancing about...

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Don't see me! Don't see me!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're in its butt. How can it see you?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grog. As you're holding onto the axe, you see before you, just pass underneath the leg and the front arms that are reaching down, this giant, dark, looming projection comes down and looks right towards you. The horned front of the dragon as Umbrasyl stares right into your face and goes, "There you are." (draws in breath, exhales) And unleashes a torrent of acid towards you. I need you to go ahead and make-- this is going to roll a dexterity saving throw. You have disadvantage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I do?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Because you're currently holding onto the chain, but I believe you have advantage on them because you are a barbarian.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I have Danger Sense. So just one roll?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. So just roll.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's not great. 11.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Can I-- do I see them?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No! They are way over-- they're like a tiny little dragon speck in the distance. We'll get to you guys here in just a moment, but their situation is a little more dire and immediate, so I have to figure out what's going on with them right now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What if we could've chased after them? Right away?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can if you want to. Did you want to go after them?

lines.name: LAURA, TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I would have chased after them, immediately, when it took off.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, we'll get to that in just a minute. As it is-- the dragon's speed is it can fly 80 feet per round.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's really fast, though.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, and it's making double-dash manoeuvring here, even at your fly speed on the broom--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What do great eagles have? Giant eagles, I think, have really fast speed too.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Let's check that real fast. Giant eagles--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Do you want something that way?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So, if the eagles were to pick up somebody--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: First off, Grog, you take 62 points of acid damage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nice.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait, you have acid resis-- no, you don't, because Keyleth-- it went away.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It went away?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, remember? Because she used--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She took damage and it dropped.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I took damage, I'm sorry. It wasn't my fault. I lost concentration. Blame the dragon that did 40 damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, as the stream pours past you, you feel your flesh burning, and elements of your skin are actually sloughing off and plummeting beneath you like a thick oatmeal.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Gross!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Umbrasyl slows down a little bit in not doing the double-dash maneuver. That's going to end Umbrasyl's turn. So you sent the eagles after--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well no, I wanted the eagles to pick up Pike and Percy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So the eagles swing by--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait, not yet. Stone! Stone!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Throw her the teleport stone!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Gatestone! I pull it out of my bag. Pass it to her.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to hop on an eagle.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I literally am sending the eagles as this is happening and I dash out of the tree on my broom, and go for the Immovable Rod, just long enough to stop and grab it and keep taking off after the dragon.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so you retrieve the rod, grab it, and head off in that direction. So we now have both of you, on eagle-back, heading off, with you trailing behind as you can't quite travel at the same speed as the eagles.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to try and clear my gun while I'm up there, too.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Keyleth, what are you doing?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You've got a ride. Animal handling. I'm going to drop and I'll start focusing on the Gatestone.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So, situated, I'm just going to try and clear the gun and see if it's an easy fix.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Nope. Gun's broken.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's broken?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, gun's broken. I've got another gun, but big gun's broken.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, Bad News is out. All right. As you're flying off you're having a hard time with the bumpy ride, as this eagle also has been near death due to being partially dissolved by the acidic attack from the dragon before. It wasn't the acid, it was something else that wrecked it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, it was a bite or a claw.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, I think it was a bite or a claw, because the acid would've destroyed it. So the eagle's heavily wounded, and due to it shuddering and trying to keep up it just causes you to end up bending a portion of the actual weapon.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Damn it. I put it away.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're concentrating on the stone.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: One minute, baby.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Bringing us back now. Grog, you're recovering from this attack.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I look down and I see my beautiful body tattoos melting away like instant oatmeal. Not even like the nice apples and cinnamon kind, it's like the maple brown sugar that no one--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's my favorite kind of oatmeal.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And it makes me so angry that I go into a rage?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Do recall, you do have one point of exhaustion since your frenzied rage did wear off beforehand.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Right, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you go into a rage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh but we have Heroes' Feast, is that good?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It doesn't help with that, no.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right. So I go in a rage, and I would like to try and continue climbing up the remainder of the distance to Umbrasyl.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Athletics check, with advantage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That was a one.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, that's way better!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's much better. That's a 29.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You find your way up, grabbing onto the edge of the tail, and you actually pull yourself up onto the base of the tail. You're on the back of Umbrasyl right now. The chain is still currently attached to its side.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Khaleesi!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Mother of dragons! Do I have any more movement?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's taken your whole turn to really get up there. Are you going to dislodge the Bloodaxe, or leave it there?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm going to dislodge it, because it was already so weak.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so go ahead and make your check to remove it. It's a DC 12, I think.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's a one. Yep.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And thank god it did. However, at this point, it's proving that that is now coming back to haunt you, as it is really hard to pull it from where it's stuck in the dragon. That's going to be the end of your turn. Vax.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: First turn I'm going to use the dragon blade to attack and slice downward and try to wedge that hole open a little bigger.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Nine plus my strength for this sword, right, not dexterity?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct. I'm letting this one be a finesse.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I probably hit him before. So that's a 25.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 25? You carve an opening in the side about a foot and a half in full length there. As you drag it you hear a roaring. Go ahead and roll damage on that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's 1d8 plus your dex--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, I know, I got that written down, thank you. 16.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 16? All righty.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And then, this is a game rules thing. Grog's within five feet of this thing and I'm no longer at disadvantage. Or am I?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is less rules and more narrative. You don't understand the body or where you really are in the body of the dragon. He's not threatening the creature right now. If anything, it's potentially threatening you. This would not be a sneak attack.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm not arguing, I'm asking what's possible.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No worries.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'll use the dagger to hit. Am I at disadvantage with the dagger still?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'd say yes, because the only reason you didn't have disadvantage with the other blade is because it was within an existing wound and then you pulled back.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Then I miss.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, the other dagger, you go ahead and stab again, this time it hits a dense part of muscle and does sink in, but not enough to do any serious damage from the inside.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And there's air queefing in and out of this slot? (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A little bit, yes. It's about that wide. You staying there?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes. No. I'm going to slide my body and try to stick head and dagger arm out of it and hang half in and half out, if possible.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. Go ahead and make a straight strength check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You plant your feet against the other muscle wall that you are between and you push off and get yourself through. And in the most awkward, tiny birth, just above your armpits, your head and arm emerge out the side. Immediately a gust of wind hits your hand as you realize and look down: you are hundreds of feet above the ground. Bramblewood right beneath you. But you are partially out of the dragon.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You can breathe!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (gasps for air)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Take a deep breath. You take three points of crushing damage as the muscle walls around you are still squeezing in on you in your current placement. That ends your turn. You! At the top of your round, your snake takes acid damage. Only one point of acid damage. How many hit points does your poisonous snake have?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't think he has very many.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It may have less than one hit point, in which case, you're just going to turn right back into Scanlan.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I think he's dead.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Let's find out. It has two hit points!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh god! Oh no, but wait, I took damage last round, too.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That was before you transformed. It was at the top of your round.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, I'm not going to try that any more. If I drop form, is that my whole round?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, you just let it go.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to drop the snake. Snake was a try and fail.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It was a good idea. Just not a very strong snake.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I drop the snake, try to get that little bubble of air (gasps), and I'll fucking cast Bigby's Hand.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay! So, using that little pocket of air, you bring your hand up, you do your quick somatic components, shouting the phrase, and Bigby's Hand appears and is currently being squished between some of the walls of the stomach.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can he move at all?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. I would like to fist the wound. Jam it, find a finger and-- how you like that?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're fingering the wound. Okay! (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This wound will never heal.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So would it be a forceful hand?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and roll an athletics check for Bigby, which is strength 28, so add plus eight to the roll.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Total of 12?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is just chilling right there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This is so embarrassing! Wow! (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm blushing, man!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All about phrasing.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wow! Okay!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, that's your turn.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I have movement, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do have movement, yes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I can't move anywhere! I have climbing stuff with me. Can I move my arms at all?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can move your arms, yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I would like to take out a grappling hook and grab onto the inside lining of the stomach.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, make a strength check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nope! Six!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Six. You take it and (ting, swish). It just slips along the very heavy mucous material lined interior of the stomach. There's a little scrape line, but that's about it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I can't do anything! It's great.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Top of Umbrasyl's round. Breath weapon does not return. However, is going to use one of its legendary actions and attempt to beat its wings to shake you off of it, Grog.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are you raging?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I need you to go ahead and make a dexterity saving throw.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Which I have advantage on. 18.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 18. You take 15 points of bludgeoning damage, which is reduced by half, so you're only taking seven. However, you are knocked prone.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughing) On his back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, which causes you to begin tumbling off the back of the tail. The wind of it-- (thump thump)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Shit!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The chain of returning is still attached to you, however, and as you go tumbling off the back of the tail, it catches you, and you are now swinging towards the back of the creature, of the dragon now, back where you started. Only the dragon is very aware of your presence. But you didn't plummet to your death!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's good!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That was the end of your turn. Now it's the top of Umbrasyl's turn.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: These dragons are hard to kill!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, imagine that! At this point, now, as this has gone on for a little while as you guys began to ascend and it went upward, it's now partway up the mountainside. You can see the forest has gotten more sparse. There are trees scattered across the top of the mountaintop.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We're close to Gatshadow already?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can see it. You're not there, but it's going across the forest top and it's coming towards the actual mountain base. It hasn't quite ascended it completely.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What about giant eagles with people on them?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're keeping in tandem with it. They're not able to quite catch up entirely, just due to the nature of the fast dragon.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Arrow range?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not for her, unfortunately, no.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're not within 400 feet of it, are we?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You, at this point, jumping on, would just be on the outside of the range if you wanted to try. You're at disadvantage on these attacks because you are on the back of a flying, wounded bird.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't let the bird get hit by Umbrasyl!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Natural 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With disadvantage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do it again.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: 18, that'll do. 27 to hit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That hits. Go ahead and roll damage.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, and he still has-- no, I lost Hex.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You lost Hex, yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You're doing great, de Rolo, come on! Keep your head in the game.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: 14 points of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (grunting) The head looks back towards the rest of you, now approaching at a distance.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do not let the bird get hit! You will plummet to your fucking death.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to spend the rest of my attack pushing the eagle down to fly at tree level.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (spellcasting) You can't hear it. You're too far away.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: She can read lips!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm so far away! I just want to know what he's saying.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The outer view of the dragon shimmers for a second and then vanishes from sight.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are we visible?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We're not like Wonder Woman inside the jet? What about my hand hanging out?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. You see the dragon.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What about Grog?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grog is kiting through the air.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You have Hunter's Mark.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: So we can see Grog?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: In theory, yeah, if you can keep a bead on him.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm enlarged.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A very heavy Grog.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is he Hunter's Marked still--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He would be. You haven't taken a lot of damage yet, or at all.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I haven't taken any damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Then you still have Hunter's Mark on him, yeah. Continues upward. That comes to the next part. Grog, you're up.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I had one question. I drank that Potion of Speed. It hastes me for a minute. How many rounds is a minute?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That has gone away, unfortunately.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, there's nothing to do but to climb back up the chain!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an athletics check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Up the chain! Fucking weiner snap. 15.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15? All righty. You manage to pull yourself halfway up the chain. You get back to where you were towards the base of the tail. That's the extent of your round there. The wind resistance itself, you can see the axe itself, after you tried to tug it forward, did bring it a little loose. So its position is still a little precarious.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Might as well say something cool. I can do this all day! I'm really not confident.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Vax.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I would like to use my movement, if I can, with the blade I used to go this way, and I cut a big foot-long thing. I want to try to use my movement to reverse the direction of the blade and stab inward.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It would be part of the attack to draw it out and attack. It wouldn't use your movement. It would be part of the attack to draw it out and attack with it. It wouldn't use your movement.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: My dagger hand's the one that's out. I want to try to maneuver the sword around and stab inward and keep cutting bacon in here. I want to attack the dragon, but still from the inside with the hand that's inside.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You're in a weird position now where the blade's at your side, so pulling away from the body, there's very little strength to pull that way, since you punched through the wound. So you're essentially holding the blade right here.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Then if I did this, can I just continue to saw in the same direction and do an attack?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You'd be at a disadvantage on it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Then I'm going to attack at disadvantage with the dragon blade, and then I'm going to stab with the dagger that's outside.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Dragon blade on the inside rolled a 15.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's just not enough strength to get it though. You try and pull upward and the blade comes loose, comes towards your body, but doesn't actually find any additional part of the muscle to cut through.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Dagger on the outside is 21.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 21? Just scrapes across the hide. Not strong enough to pierce it from the outside. You do also take one point of bludgeoning damage as the wound tenses around you once more. Scanlan!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: For my bonus action, I'm going to fist the dragon again! Just going to jam it in there!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll an athletics check with plus eight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As it punches through, temporarily leaving an open wound in the side of its stomach area, Bigby's Hand is partially outside the dragon now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Great!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And you currently have a little bit of light that's visible before the wound closes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Before the wound closes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The muscles re-tense. You watch it punch through and everything (gasp). It's the moment of impact.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to jump in the hole.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You leap in after Bigby's Hand just in the wake of it slamming into the side of the muscle of the stomach walls. In that one moment, you're rushing past, you can feel the actual muscles tensing behind you. Go ahead and make a dexterity saving throw.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Dexterity saving throw. 18!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 18! Okay! You manage to leap behind Bigby's Hand and grab onto the side of it as the hand punches entirely out of the dragon's body, the wound slamming shut behind.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh god, I'm outside the dragon?!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You are now outside the dragon.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (screams) Shit!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Holding onto Bigby's Hand.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is he flying? Does he stay still? What does he do?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He is flying.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He can fly?!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Bigby's Hand!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Not as fast as the dragon.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Bigby's Hand can move up to 60 feet, so no, it's slower than the dragon. Starting to drag a little bit behind as it's moving.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: God. Okay! Hand can't do anything else, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, that was its action. That's most of your turn, really, at this point. That was your movement to push through after the bonus attack, so you have your action. I'll give you your action.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're not going to let me cast another spell, probably.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You look down below you suddenly after you take a moment to look, and you can see part of Vax emerging from the side of the dragon. And then the whole dragon and Vax vanish.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh shit! Wait, I see Grog?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do see Grog, dangling from the chain, slowly pulling his way up towards the back.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (screaming) Scanlan!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm holding onto the hand?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (screaming) What the fuck?!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The Hand can't do anything else.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not this turn, no.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Shit. I just got out of the dragon. I don't know what's going on. I didn't even know we were flying. I'm just going to shoot a Lightning Bolt at him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Advantage on the dexterity saving throw. What's the DC of it? The DC of the Lightning Bolt?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's my spell. It's not through the Hand Cone, I assume.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nope, you are clutching both hands onto the side.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 18. It makes the save. Roll damage, and it takes half damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 26. All right, so it takes 13 points of lightning damage. (blast) The bolt streaks upward, hitting the sides of the wound that you just came out of it, and arcs up the side of the body. Most of it is absorbed from the hefty, scaled hide of the black dragon, but it does (unhappy groan) roil with pain. You hear it yelling, and with a very slight shifting of light, you notice the dragon is still there, and you recognize this. This is an Invisibility spell. That ends your turn.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I guess so.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The dragon's far out of range of anything you have, and it's just seems to be coasting as fast as it can out of the way, so you have nothing, I don't think, that can really go past a 300, 400 foot range. So you're just keeping on that eagle, holding on. You as well, you're behind the others, just slowly falling behind.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How fast can my broom go?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I think it's 50 feet. I can look it up again real fast. It's not a racing broom. Quidditch broom. I'll find it for you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And my boots of haste don't do shit to a broom.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm going to look it up right now, just to let you know, so we can all relax.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's the fastest model yet! I love Harry Potter.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grog's just become this little speck in the distance. All right, so as that's going on, are you doing anything?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to keep my eyes peeled on what I can see and try to keep up as best I can at treeline, like below.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Back to the top of the round. The dragon, Umbrasyl, now (wings flapping). Even you are being dragged behind nothing, you can hear the wings beating. You still have full sight of the dragon at this point. The voice growls out of its throat, "Fine. Let's see how well you hold on, insects!" It begins to spin and do a barrel roll. I need both of you, as also its muscles tense, to roll strength saving throws.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I have advantage on those.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Six.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Six?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (popping) Comes free. Thankfully, you were in an up arc, but you are now arcing in the air. You also get ejected from the wound from the muscles tensing behind, it almost squeezes you out. Before you can even get a grapple on, the dragon vanishes from sight and you're now falling backwards.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'd like take a chance to say, here, that when I went into this dragon, I was lost, and a wanderer. As I am shat out its side, I come forth a paladin of the Raven Queen. I have multiclassed and leveled up. And the last thing I'm thinking as I shoot out this hole in its side is: if you have any wings to lend me, now is the time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As you emerge from the body of Umbrasyl, there is a streak of shadow that scatters into a burst of darkened raven feathers that fill the air around you. You still plummet, but as a nature of your prayer, that brief moment of understanding, it appears there is some reaction. That'll be that element there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Where am I in my minute?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, you're like 20 seconds in. 30 seconds in.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Are they all falling?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys now watch as, suddenly, Grog and Vax just (rush of air). Vax appears out of nowhere and is falling. Scanlan's being held aloft by a distant Bigby's Hand, and Grog is arcing in the air. At that point now, Grog, Vax, what are you doing as you're falling backward?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I pull out a fancy robe, of which there are two, and pull it out. I'm going to drop the Bloodaxe. I'm going to grab both ends of the fancy robe and just make the shittiest parachute of all time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (air puffs)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: There ain't much else to do.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Shitty G.I. Joes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Plummeting down towards the Bramblewood. Vax.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hey, I'm a brand new paladin. Lay on Hands, which is going to do fuck all for me, but is that a bonus action?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I believe it's an action.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: An action? Okay. I'm going to cast Lay on Hands on myself. And I'm going throw my poison dagger at the dragon as I fall. That's a 23.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 23 does hit.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is ten points of damage with poison on it. It's a DC of 15 for poison. I'm sure it makes it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, it makes it. It would've had to roll a one to not make it, unfortunately.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Could I add one bonus thing at the end of mine?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I see Scanlan and Bigby's Hand at all? Or is the world just a clusterfuck?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check, just glancing around you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Four.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Four. No. You see earth beneath you, sky above, mountain to your left, and the inevitable plummet coming at you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm thinking about my mother as I fall backward through space.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Distance between me and them?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Vax is about 20 feet from you, Grog's about 60, 70 feet from you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What's the range of-- shit.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: 50 feet.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Remember, we're going to be going the same direction.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They're both falling, yeah. Vax will hit the ground first.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Vax will?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm higher.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The dragon's moved ahead to this point now since you guys have fallen off.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is anyone higher than me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grog is. Vax is a little bit below you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And he's not flying or anything, is he?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's trying. He's holding a scrap piece of fabric that's just (rustling fabric).

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I've seen Percy make shit, I can do it, too! (blows puffs of air)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're doing very well. You're doing very well.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wow. This didn't go well.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm hoping you can hold on for a minute.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. Yeah! I'm going to drop Bigby's-- 60 feet is not plummeting speed? I can't catch up to them as they fall?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right now, you could catch up to one of them.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right. Because Grog is over me, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, Grog is in an arc, so you would have to meet him as he fell.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll try to catch him then.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so you clutch onto Bigby's Hand and move as he plummets.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Shit, wait. Wait.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What are you doing? What are you doing, Scanlan?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Shit. Vax is below me, though.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He said you can get to one of them, so it's just a Sophie's Choice.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's a Sophie's Choice.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But who's on the lowest hit points?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, I would go for Grog if he's above me, with the hand.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. The hand comes forward, sends out this cupping motion, the fingers below. You, eyes closed, clenching tight, (impact). All of a sudden, the wind stops, and it's like you're being held by your mother again, a memory you haven't recalled since you were a child. You open your eyes slowly, and you're still above the ground! Holy shit! But there's a giant purple hand around you and a very freaked out Scanlan clutching the outside.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Look what you did!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll start moving us slowly down, I guess.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That was the turn to even get to him and catch him.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Then-- fuck.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You still have an action if you have anything.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I can't see the dragon anymore, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No. You have a vague idea of where it might be.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you still have Polymorph?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, concentration.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fuck.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's useful.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That seems like a really good use.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I got Grog. Fuck. Okay. I'm going to drop Bigby's Hand and Polymorph Grog into an eagle.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So, as you look over at Scanlan, with a big look of relief and thank you, he gives you a cursory look as the hand vanishes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What. What?! (screams)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Holding on to him!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He grabs you real fast, and suddenly you have feathers! What the shit! And, strangely, you become smarter! As giant eagles have an intelligence of eight.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Quick, come up with a plan!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's a new day, baby.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: His brain is just geometry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a Beautiful Mind moment in the middle of the sky. Suddenly you understand, the instinct hits you, and (whoosh). You have wings. You feel Scanlan's tiny hands grasping the back of your neck.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And I just yell at him, dive, motherfucker, dive!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (caw)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. You guys start seeing this happen in the distance and a little sparkle of hope hits you, whatever it may be. Coming back around to the top, Umbrasyl is taking a double dash motion. He's past.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He got away.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grog, it's your turn.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I see that flurry of black feathers streaking downwards of this guy?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're coming out of nowhere. It is this long, visual line of black feathers that are being tossed from beneath Vax's flapping cape.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're going full Point Break terminal velocity, straight down towards Vax.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I hope I can hold on! There's nothing to grab onto, is there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's just heavy feathers and digging in.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Luckily, I have a grappling hook. (dink dink dink)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Maybe in my dive position I could squeeze your legs with my wings, how about that?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're really smart. You would think to do that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I would.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, you would.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I would also think, what idiot was just flying behind the back of this dragon on a chain? What a fool.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So as you go into a full dive, that's 80 speed, that's 160 feet. (whoosh) You manage to just crest underneath the plummeting Vax, the trail of black feathers, trailed by a long line of brown feathers being plucked out from Scanlan, feverishly trying to grab onto your back for some sort of purchase. Pain. You deal with pain all the time. It doesn't dissolve your focus. Vax, I need you to go ahead and attempt to grab onto the eagle as it swoops beneath you. Go ahead and make a single strength saving throw.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, wait, Luck! I have one last Luck.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is the time to use it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh my god!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As the eagle swoops underneath you, you reach out. You don't even see it, you're looking up into the sky as you plummet, the trail of feathers going past as you concentrate on the acceptance you've made to the Raven Queen, and the understanding that perhaps, if there is a chance to survive, let it be through this leap of faith you've taken in the direction of an entity that you've been so fearful of and scoffed at since she came to you in your dreams. A moment, you see the feathers begin to trail off and subside from beneath your cloak, and a voice whispers in your ear and says, "Left." Without thinking, your hand reaches out, without even seeing, and you (impact) grab the edge of Scanlan's cloak.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh no!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you're dragged behind, you (choking) from behind.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's worth it, it's worth it!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can barely breathe as the eagle swoops up, you can feel the heartbeat, the blood flowing in the back of your head, your ears hot (heartbeat) as you slowly reach over and grab the back of the eagle. Is this Keyleth? You don't know. All you know is Scanlan swooped in and in this moment of need, seemingly, a prayer was answered. So what are you guys doing?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And you're itty bitty still!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I prefer raven-sized.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, he's tiny. That's the only reason I'm not having him tear you off the back of the eagle, because of the size.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Unless I hear otherwise, I'm making a controlled descent towards the ground.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You guys see this in the distance as now the eagle captures the falling Vax and then begins to head down towards the base of the mountain where the Bramblewood meets.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I guess we head down that direction.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah. Make the eagle follow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You guys make your way downward towards the bottom. Keyleth, you finish your concentration on the stone. (whoosh) Suddenly, you step through, being pushed through a tunnel of blue light and energy, and for a moment, all you see before you is Vax's face, his tiny little raven-sized face.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So cute!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (whoosh) As you guys watch Keyleth apparate right in front of Vax, and go speeding past you, as she's now plummeting from the air, having summoned to your side.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm technically an earth elemental still.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're still earth elemental? So yeah, you see Keyleth as a giant boulder that appears at the side. You have to dodge out of the way (whoosh) as this giant rock being, out of the corner of your eye, appears before you. However, she sinks straight past you. You're flying as low as you can, you're going terminal velocity, and there is this (rumble) rock entity plummeting at the same rate.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: A meteor.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You know, it was a good idea when he was still in the dragon.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, I know. It was.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (singing) I came in like a wrecking ball!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At about 200 feet up, you continue to plummet.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: 200 feet? That's all right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. You're not doing anything else? You're going to take the fall?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, what's below me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The very edge of the Bramblewood and the base of the mountain. You're not quite sure where you'll land. You see treetops and rocks.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What's the worst that's going to happen?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I would hit zero hit points as an earth elemental and go back to Keyleth.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And then the rest of the damage would carry over.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Right, but 200 feet. That's survivable.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's 20d6.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You'll be fine. What's that? 60 points.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. It's roughly 60 points, and I've got 67 left as this earth elemental.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so you're going to take it?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thought it was only beast form. I'm going to light myself on fire and go meteor.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. You guys watch as the earth elemental curls up, forms this streak of flame and smoke behind, and now a plummeting Keyleth meteor goes slamming into the base of the mountain just past you as you pull up from impacting at terminal velocity.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I was trying to leave an impression. No pun intended.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You suffer 76 points of bludgeoning damage upon impact.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (boom) This giant crater is left around your form as now there is this somewhat smoke-swirled Keyleth sprawled out in the center of this.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I drop, and I stand up, Keyleth, in the middle of a giant crater.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The rest of you all eventually catch up. The eagle-back carriers, you on broomback, finding your party bruised, hurt, but ultimately survived this moment of the encounter. As you've all had this moment to yourself, Vex, you hear a noise to your left coming from the exterior of the Bramblewood.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I see what it is?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You glance off to the side, and you can see, emerging, slowly from the forest, a single humanoid standing before you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is he single?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: An older woman, an older goliath woman, missing one eye and missing her forearm-- her left arm, right at the elbow. The right arm clutches a very tall quarterstaff that is being used as a walking stick as she wanders up. You can see dirt smeared in her face, darker dreadlocks pulled tight against the back of the head that dangle past the shoulders, tattoos similar to the ones that adorn Grog across the face and shoulders. She slowly walks towards the party. Let's go ahead and bring our guest for the evening out. You can go around the other way. Let's welcome Chris Perkins!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Welcome, Chris, welcome!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is he coming to this side?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right to the edge, next to you, Keyleth.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you know how to play this game?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Keyleth meteor, what?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, that's me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As she steps up and emerges from the forest, everyone turns and sees the worry on Vex's face.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughs) Vax pours a drink.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It was very frightening.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Halt! Who are you?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: My name is Shale.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What's your business here?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: I was following a scouting party out to the mountain. But these old bones don't take me as far as fast as they used to.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do I recognize Shale?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do, actually. Not very well. Shale has been around longer than you have as part of the herd, but is mostly considered past her prime as a warrior. Since she lost her arm, was set to the side, and a lot of the herd seems to not value their elders when they become less powerful in battle, but even still, she carries a bit of spit and vinegar to her. But it's been a while since you've seen her, and to see her surviving out here, both curious and honorable.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Shale.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sorry. You're still an eagle.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (caw)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (caw)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Grog, do you want to say something?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: I will brandish my quarterstaff, my rune-covered quarterstaff, and try to hold this big creature at bay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Shale's holding her staff out.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Stand down, bird!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I love you! Let me love you!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll drop the form.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Thank you, god. Shale.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Grog? Is that you?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, it's me. I know, you can't tell.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: You're kind of a blur. What's on your face?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's a beard.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: You've gotten big.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. Lots of lifting. Lots of running, getting strong.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Last time I saw you, you were the runt of the goatball team.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You were a runt, Grog?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, when I was born, she means. When I was born.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Was he rather small?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: He was puny.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Puny compared to mountains and stuff.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What's goatball?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: It's a game you play. You stand on pillars of rock, and you hurl balls at each other.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Made of goats?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Made of goatskins. Skins, my dear.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sounds kind of fun.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: The object of the game is to knock the other opponents off their pillars.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's more civilized than what we were imagining.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's a lot of fun, actually.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Shale, what were you doing out here with a scouting party? It seems--

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: We were spying on the dragon. Damnable beast.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did you succeed?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: No. The scouting team did not fare well.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are any of them still alive?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: No. They're all dead.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How did you survive?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: I was slow and stupid. I shouldn't have gone at all. I couldn't keep up with them. By the time I got to them, they were corpses.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You sound like an excellent addition to our team, then.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: She says, I would have killed the dragon as soon as it came upon us, when we first arrived in Westruun, but that damn Kevdak formed an alliance with the beast.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait, you think you can kill a dragon?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Wait, what did you just say? Oh.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We knew that.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yes. Realized it as I was saying it.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: That is how I wanted to die. Fighting the dragon.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's funny, we almost just died fighting the dragon. How ironic.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We put a good hurting on it, yeah. Do you-- I mean, not like I'm questioning what can you do, because I don't think it's very much.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm actually great. I'm just in a smoldering meteor and look like a badass.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Which caught your attention, the large, crashing boom.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: That was it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I yank on Vex's hand from down below and say, pick me up! Put me on your shoulder!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What's the matter? Can you not see anything down there? I pop Trinket out and put Vax on top of him. Don't you feel so tall now?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I am tall.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How much longer is he going to be tiny?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: How long does the potion last?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I rolled a three, so that's three hours.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, three hours.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Sweet.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We have to decide what to do. He's gone back to his hole. He's going to rest. He's going to heal.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I just have such a hard time taking you seriously right now. I'm so sorry.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So you had to have been a part of this party for a reason. What's in your bag of tricks? What can you do?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: I smash things with my stick.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: With your stick. Does magic come out of your stick?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: It is a magical staff.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, well, that's good.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, we could use more of those.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is it a magical staff of dragon killing?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: It will be if we get on with it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I like that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I like her, too.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So, Shale, did you and your scouting party find out any additional information that might be handy?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe how to get into the lair without it knowing?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What she said.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: I know nothing of use.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's wonderful.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You never made it up to the cave entrance, did you?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: I made it up to the dead ones. That's as far as I got.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How far were the dead ones?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: A ways.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I hate to tell you this, but Kevdak is gone.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: No great loss.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Your whole herd may have perished fighting this same dragon.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Not all of them.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: A lot of them.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: But it will all be worth it if we can remove the head of this shitty black dragon.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: I agree.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Plus, Zanror is still alive, as is his wife. I think.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Maybe.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We hope.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Possibly.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So, how far would you think that we are from his lair?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: I'll just crane my neck up the mountain.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a sizable climb. Gatshadow-- While this portion is the south part of the Cliffkeep Mountains, which get higher the further north you go, this mountain is called Gatshadow because it is dark and ominous and stands out amongst the rest of the mountains. While the other ones crest at about maybe 4,000 feet up, this one's nearly a mile, a little over a mile high.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, we can obviously fly.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are sparse trees, most of them dead or dried out towards the top, but other than that the vegetation is pretty sparse.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Look, I'm a little jacked up. I think those two are a little jacked up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I could use a short rest.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's fair to assume that he will do the same thing, yeah?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Go brush his teeth, have a deuce, all that stuff.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're trying to catch the dragon while he's still debilitated, right?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The longer we wait, the harder it will be.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What if I just heal everybody and we keep on?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, that's great.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I don't want to lose the damage that's on him.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How long has it been, a minute? Two minutes?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Since you guys landed here? It's probably been about two, three minutes.
