lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We've got to move.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can we travel a mile up a mountain quickly?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We have eagles.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Even at your fastest pace, eagle speed...

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The broom and the two eagles at this point?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The broom is slower than the eagles. Eagle speed you're looking at about-- I'm estimating somewhere between ten to 20 minutes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's enough for a short rest for it. He's not going to go back to full strength, but he's going to go back up a bit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Would we know that?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We don't know what he has access to.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Generally, they don't-- They themselves can recover over time, and if given a full day or so, they can largely recover from the wounds they have sustained almost entirely, especially a dragon as powerful as an ancient. You would know that, because they understand and fear their demise, or at least are arrogant enough to think it's not possible, they will have certain reserves to try and help them recover if they ever find themselves in a dire circumstance. Occasionally, depending on the intelligence of the dragon and what resources it has at its disposal.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Reserves. What do you mean?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Healing stuff?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Some semblance of healing magic, items they may have acquired that can help. The longer you wait, the more it can recover, is essentially what it comes down to.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We need to go now. We need to go.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Should we mist form it there? Can we do that?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That takes too long to think about.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can get us there via trees.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But you'd need to know a tree that's there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I need to know a tree that's there. I could Scry, look for the closest tree, teleport us there, but by the time I'm getting there, I'm exhausted.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are you able to see a tree from a great distance?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: If I Scry.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Not even by eyesight?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mean, I guess I can look around and take a guess.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm going to cast Mass Cure Wounds on everybody.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Go ahead and do that. And Shale, you feel nice and warm at full health as the Mass Cure Wounds tickles you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is your arm back?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Unfortunately, no. If only!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The temporary hit points never go back up, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct, no. They were just for that little bit of damage.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Lost it in an avalanche, I did.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Today?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: No, turd.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The Scrying will take you about ten minutes or so.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are we going to Scry it or are we just going to go? How long would it take if we just flew up? 20 minutes?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's if you were all on eagle-back. Which you don't. You have eight people, and you currently have two summoned eagles.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Speed of the slowest.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, the speed of the slowest here, you're looking at walking up the mountain.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. So I can teleport us closer and then walk, or we can take a very short rest so I can get my beast shaping back, and then could fly a few more of us. It's a gamble.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: You take your rest, love. I'll start up the mountain.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Shale walks away and starts hiking up the rocks at the very base of Gatshadow.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I just say that we agree that the reason we didn't do what Zanror wanted and go to the lair is because it's a fucking death trap?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, but the dragon is injured now.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: But he's going to heal up by the time we get there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Not all the way.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Pretty good.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's still the best chance we have. We have to kill it now.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: In its lair?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: It's your destiny to fight the dragon, Grog.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait, what? What was that, Shale? Is that true?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Everybody is healed 27.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: It's just a thing old women say.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just let him believe it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Kiki, may I have my-- Sorry. (higher voice) May I have my cloak back?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, yeah, sure.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Thank you. (flump, whoosh)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: To attune to it will take you a short rest.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So are we resting?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's up to you guys.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't know. But I'm still putting it on.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: When I turned into the eagle, what happened to the Bloodaxe and chain?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Actually, you check, and the equipment that you have attuned to you and attached go into the form with you, so at this moment you realize, "Oh, the axe!" You look behind you, and it's just been dragging behind you in the dirt, carving this path in the rocks and rubble.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. That's nifty.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Like a kid with a deflated balloon you're just dragging behind you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I-- well, I can't sense anything about it with Hunter's Mark, I just know where he is.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You know where it is.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And he's up in his lair.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He is up at the top of Gatshadow, somewhere in that mountain.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Moving around, or is he chilling?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At the moment, seems chilling.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Short rest or not, what are you guys doing?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How long would the hike up the mountain be? An hour?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's about a mile up. You're looking at the better part of a day.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, a mile up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Unless we fly.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What if we take shifts with the eagles?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Take shifts with the eagles? Back and forth?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Eagles fly a group up, fly down, pick up another group and bring them?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Probably about an hour.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: But that's an hour with a short rest for everybody as well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you're going to do it that way, yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Half could rest at the top while the eagles fly back, and the ones at the bottom could rest.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So there's a short rest.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Shifts of resting, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're still looking at about an hour and a half at that point, with people moving there and back and getting enough rest. You can't short rest on the trip, and the short rest is about an hour, half an hour.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Eagles drop off, they rest while the eagles return, and the people at the bottom rest while the eagles are making the trip, no?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right, but you still have to have the eagles that went to the bottom to pick up the second team to get there, so you're still looking at about an hour and a half to two hours.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I could also use another spell and summon a couple more eagles.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I could summon two more eagles.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's worth it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And that could get how many of us up?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All of us up at the same time.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But one is just for Grog, right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But two more eagles would get all of us up?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a concentration spell. You can only have one of it up at a time.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It is?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. And it only lasts for an hour, and you've already been at this for probably about ten, 15 minutes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So they're about to go away.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have about another 40 minutes of the eagles.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They'd dissipate.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You'd just have to recast it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That seems like our fastest option. What's the other option? A short rest and then we bamf.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We rest and then go. If we rest for 30 minutes, and then I switch and then we have the eagles, then we can get up in another 30 minutes, and then it's an hour. Theoretically, short resting is our shortest.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You said you have Transport Via Plants, right?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I do.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you wanted to Scry up that mountain and look at one of the trees at the top, you could do that. That would be, technically, the fastest way.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But then we'd still have to hike. How long would the hike be?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It depends on how close the nearest tree to the cavern would be.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's do that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But I can do it. It's what we think is most important.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Once they're used up, they're gone at the top, and then I'll just summon two more and send everybody else up? Once the people make it up the top, that way it takes less time. A couple people hop on the eagles right now, because we only have a little bit of time left.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I rest? Can I rest while the first round goes?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're fighting a dragon in its lair! In the worst place we could possibly fight it!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We've also dealt so much damage to it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Umbrasyl was looking pretty rough.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I fisted through it!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He said looking pretty rough.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's because he's a liar and a bringer of death, and he is smiling at you while he does it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I know.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What are we going to do today with Chris Perkins? Talk, or go fucking kill a dragon?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Would you like a tour of Whitestone? It's really lovely this time of year.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: I'm judging you!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Grog, she's right. It is your destiny.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: In your tiny voice.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What are you laughing at?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Everybody hop on an eagle.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I hop on an eagle.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Hopping on an eagle.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, no, half of the people hop on an eagle.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Two of the halflings-- two of the gnomes can get on.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Scanlan.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm in back?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm sort of a halfling. Can I get on too?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At your size? The three of you would probably be able to take one eagle, because you are tiny.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, that's right, he's a little one.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right. You guys go.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: See you in a bit, sis! Bye, Keek!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So we'll say, for the purposes of this, it'll take an additional cast of your spell, so mark off a second casting of Conjure Woodland Beings. However, that brings-- What level is that?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That is level-- Oh, good. Level three.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Conjure Woodland Beings?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So I've got two level threes left. With my Pearl of power.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Conjure Woodland Beings is a 4th-level spell, Laura.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I have Conjure Animals, not Woodland Beings.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll be back here in a few minutes. In the meantime we have an awesome video from Backblaze to show you guys--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yay!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's really cute.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's for you guys!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Welcome back, everyone. We've had a little break here. A quick announcement for you guys, the rebroadcast tonight will be delayed for about 30 minutes as we have to shoot something directly after this so we can all go home. So, if you guys are in chat after and folks are showing up going, "Where's the rebroadcast?" Just let them know it'll be around, about a 20-30 minute break between. We appreciate you guys carrying that thread over to them when they arrive. So we've had a break. If you wanted to use any of your hit dice to heal up during the short rest, now's the time to do it. You've re-attuned to the Dragon Slayer Longsword. And just so you guys know, both Grog and Vax leveled up to 14 as well. Vax took a level of paladin during the short rest. Grog also took his 14th level as a barbarian. As a berserker, a lot of you know what that means.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't know what that means.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We'll find out. I'd like to re-attune to the Cloak of Displacement. And the Boots of Haste, are they spent for the day for anybody? If I were to wear them, could I get the juice or no? They're done?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They're too big for you, teeny.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: They would shrink to me. I'm going to re-attune my Keen Dagger, then, for the moment. So it's Deathwalkers Ward, Keen Dagger, Cloak. Three items.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. I'll let it happen. Usually, you attune one item in a short rest.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, okay. No, I can do one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I think it's fine for this. You get attuned as you walk up the rest of the way. It's fine.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I've rolled all nine of my hit dice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you're out of hit dice?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Everyone else good? Ready to jump back in?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Nope.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Does anyone need more healing? Are we okay?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, we're good.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And because I Conjured Woodland Animals, I lost my Hunter's Mark.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, you did, but you know loosely where it was.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, let's hurry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: How do you wish to prepare?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I want to sleep for a day.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. I want to rock back and forth in a corner.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'd like to go stealth and I'd like to see-- is there one clear, main entrance to this place?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is a cavern opening.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are a few small little inlets into the mountain at certain points, but the path that you guys land on that ends? You're going to have to climb around the mountain to get to the entrance of this. There is no walk-up path. Actually, just an opening on the side of the mountain.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So we're further down still. We're not near the entrance?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're about 400 to 500 feet away from the entrance.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to cast Pass Without a Trace on all of us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You stealth ahead and look a little bit and you notice the path comes to an end. You probably have about a hundred feet that you have to scale the side of mountain to get to the entrance.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: From where I am, I can tell that we need to climb around it. If I look very hard, do I see any little holes or cracks or anything above?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see one other small entrance about maybe 60 feet below it, a little bit to the left.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Pretty cool sound effects

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: It's freaking me out.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is that your music?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is not my music. That's the atmosphere.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Shale, Shale. The scouting party. Where did you find the bodies? Where were they left?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Which actually you-- this was probably a couple hundred feet back. They made it near the peak. However, they were spotted upon the approach, and you heard the battle. The very short battle that ensued. Heard the screams of them, far from your eyesight.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: I will have pointed them out, then.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How far above our position is that smaller entrance-- (noise of hissing gas)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's all atmosphere, guys. I paid them to do it. I know. All right. Towards where the actual walkable portion of this mountain cliff ends, you have about 40 feet of scaleable wall, at an upward angle, before you can reach that small little inlet that you saw there. An additional 60 feet beyond that is the larger entrance where you saw, the best you can tell, Umbrasyl retreat towards-- or exit before, when you were watching him emerge from the mountain. That's it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What do you think? Do you think I should climb in that little hole?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you want-- say that again?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There's a main entrance above. But there's also a smaller, little gap lower down. He cannot fit in there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can try and scry inside the cavern.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: See if it's something that would be worth--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Get a battle perspective?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right. You have to give me a few minutes. Is everyone all right with that?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I use my ranger skills to try to camouflage us into the side of the mountain? To make us even more non-seeable?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. Totally. So we'll say for the purposes of that, anyone at this point who'd like to make a stealth check, to go ahead and keep yourselves hidden from any onlooking parties.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Natural 20.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Add ten.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Natural 20!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hey!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Add ten for Pass Without a Trace.

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Whoa!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What?! (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Why, I do declare.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Well, I do declare I'm invisible.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With Vex's help, you guys manage to take bits of the mud, soot, and the burnt remnants of the once lush forest that dotted this mountainside, and darken your exteriors to help obscure the vision of anything that wished to pry, along with the magic drawing the shadows to your forms. You're pretty confident that most of you would be fairly difficult to be spotted by most creatures.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I would just like to point out that my complete total is 45.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Of stealthing?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thank you. Thank you for pointing that out.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes. It's mostly for your benefit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I appreciate it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's ridiculous.

lines.name: ASHLEY, LAURA
lines.text: How?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Natural 20, plus my 15 benefit, plus Pass Without a Trace. Poof! (vanishing sound)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Marty McFly's holding a photograph.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Exactly. All right. So, what's up now?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I take a little of the soot, and I give myself some druid battle make-up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you go, just smear it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. Did you scry yet?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm about to.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. I do the same thing. I soot my face up, too. Let's all make battle paint while she's scrying.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Pretentious asshole.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I get soot on my finger and walk up to Percy and just put a line from his forehead down his face.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I feel violated, but thank you.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: I'll ask Grog if he wants any soot on his face. I'll walk over.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll put soot on your face if you come near me with that wicked, wicked staff of yours.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: This is not wicked. It's just a staff. It doesn't even have a name.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What?! How could you have a staff and not give it a name?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. My staff doesn't have a name. It's so true.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: You know, if you kill this dragon, you'll be the greatest goliath that's ever lived.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Yes!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Really?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: No one else has killed a dragon of this size. Not among us. Not among the Herd.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Pike killed a dragon.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Did you, now?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Well, we all did. But it wasn't this big.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It was pretty small.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It was pretty-- it was a lot bigger than me.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: I'm sure that experience will come in handy.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, let's do this.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right. I scry. I focus really hard on the dragon.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. On Umbrasyl?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you need any of his stomach bile to help you scry?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sure! Can I have some of the-- I scrape a little stomach bile--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Does that help? Does that help?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, here. Let me pull up the actual specifics for Scrying here.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: This is going to go well, I can feel it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait. He's going to sense what I can scry, can't he? Maybe I can just try and scry inside the lair?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It largely depends.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What do you want to do?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mean, he knows we're coming, yeah?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can you scry that little cavern to see where it leads to? Can you scry your mind up the cavern?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. Actually, can I do that? Like it's a camera drone?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's more like picking a location, as opposed to an actual--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sure. I want to try and focus on Umbrasyl's whereabouts, but I want to see if I can get a nice bird's-eye view of inside the cavern.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You are familiar with the target as you've done battles, that does adjust the saving throw for the scry. So, without further ado, what's the DC of your spells currently?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 19. Hmm. As your eyes close, your vision projects itself beyond your form, beyond the craggy landscape of Gatshadow, out beyond the mountain pass that ends abruptly. Beyond the cavern entrance, you are pulled within the darkness. Suddenly, you find a little bit of light scatters across the damp stonework of the inside of this cavern. You see stalagmites. You see pools of murky, greenish-brackish liquid, ever so gently disturbed by the wind that curls in and out of this cavern. You see towards the back an elevated platform next to another pool, where a large outcropping of stone that has just slowly pulled itself out of the rock, nearly touching the very height of this cavern. You don't see anything in there. All you hear is (low breathing sound).

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He's asleep.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: (loudly) What do you see?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, nothing now. That's it? That's all I see?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's all you see.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did you see Umbrasyl?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, but I heard him. He sounds very rough, or possibly sleeping? I don't know, there was a lot of heavy breathing. Very deep-- not, you know, shallow breathing. Not impassioned breathing, Scanlan.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Could he still be invisible?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He could I guess still be invisible. Also the cave was covered in acid pools and dark and dingy and everything else we would expect.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I know.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Let's do it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. We're going in the small hole or the big hole?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't think he caught my presence. I don't think he's necessarily expecting us. We can have the element of surprise, here.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Let me check out that hole on top. You guys can watch me do it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Go in the little hole, then.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm little now. It's a big hole. It's quite big, actually.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's roomy.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'd like to climb up to it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Go ahead--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Spider-sense tingling the whole time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So you manage to find bits of rock and pull yourself across the way. It's not too long a distance but enough to the point where I need you to go ahead and make a basic strength check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 14. Okay. It's hard and you feel part of your muscles build up lactic acid from the exertion, from the previous round with Umbrasyl and you not being necessarily the strongest individual of the troupe, but you do manage to scurry your way up to the edge of this small opening in the mountainside. Getting inside, you get a look: this hole continues for about 15 feet into the mountain before it ends abruptly. The only other thing you notice is there are currently four long-dead skeleton corpses within this hole. Perhaps some sort of mountain-climbing expedition or travelers that found their way there, and couldn't escape. There are remnants of a small camp. Perhaps a small fire that is long iced-over through winters past. A layer of dust sits on everything and other than the occasional gust of wind that finds its way in here, largely undisturbed for a long period of time.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I want to look through the remains.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You rummage through the remains. You find roughly 85 gold pieces amongst their corpses and spare change in silver and copper--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't take that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And you find a very moldy diary.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I take out the Flametongue Dagger and give myself some light.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Goats! Steal mountain goats, steal or find and kill anybody who lived in-- there used to be a smaller village that lived north on the mountainscape that is now abandoned because of this creature the folklore of the time said supposedly lived at the top of the mountain. It speaks of the entrance, the place that Umbrasyl now calls the lair, and this leads you to believe that this is a fresh lair. Umbrasyl did not appear to always live within Gatshadow, but is only currently making it its lair at the moment.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is this a dead end? Does it look like it goes further in?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: By the light of my dagger.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Actually, this would be investigation.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Investigation? All right. 20. No, wait-- Yeah, 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 20. Feeling along the walls, you find elements of the rocks that are easier to break off than others, but this is predominantly the end of this cavern.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's a cave. Okay. I tell my sister: it's a dead end. It's nothing. Coming.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So Vax finds his way back to the group.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Shale, would you like to lead the way?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Yes. Now, I may not survive this. I'm quite old, and I can only see about 30 feet ahead of me--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: My sister and I should lead the way. You stick to Grog, will you, grandma?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (whack sound)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Wait! I don't get to dodge?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The sting hits the side of your shoulder before you have a moment to really understand and your diminutive form is thrown about three or four feet back before you catch yourself.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I skitter off ahead of the group.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I cast Protection from Acid on Grog, again.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Now, if I don't survive, loves, I do have some magic on me. So this staff has runes. You can scratch them off and magical things will appear! And this horn, if you blow it real loud, it will let out a tremendous thunder that could bring down the entire cave.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't think you should be planning for your own death!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'll take the horn.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: It might explode.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It might

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: It's a little unstable.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Scanlan, you should take the horn.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She's not dead yet!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm saying when she dies. If she dies.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're not going to divvy up her stuff! That's bad luck!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She's bequeathing it to you in her will.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: And this pendant here, which looks like a dragon tooth, it's a dragon tooth. And if you wear it, it will close your wounds.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an insight check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Maybe we should just kill her now and take the stuff.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Natural 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Really? So, Chris?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: I'm being super sincere.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh. I really want all those things--

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Shale, you seem almost like you're--

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: My hide armor ain't worth shit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: As I was saying, you seem like you're almost expecting to die, or you're looking forward to it?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Well, I'm very old. And if I could die fighting a dragon, well, there's no better way to go. If I don't die, great! Wonderful!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right. Just checking that we wouldn't disappoint you if you don't die.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wait, just to be clear: if we kill the dragon, are you going to say you killed the dragon or would you say

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Why, you, of course.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: I'm past my prime.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We'll shake on it?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: I will shake on it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Which is easy because you put out the proper hand for the one arm she has.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Shale, what type of magic do you wield, exactly?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: I wield this staff.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. Very clear.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is going to be great! I'm on board and committed to this. This is very exciting!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Thank you, Shale. Let's try to live.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So remember, acid pools everywhere. Do we have any type of cohesive plan, or just--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're just going to go in.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just be very quiet.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm already looking for traps, looking for danger.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you're coming up to the entrance.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm not going to go in the entrance, but I'm going to try to climb up and peer over the edge and look as carefully as I can.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make another strength check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You manage to climb your way up to the larger mouth of the cavern. It's about 40 feet across at the very front of it. And about 50 feet up. It's this large--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 40 feet, 50 feet?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. And the rest of you guys? Are you pursuing?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to come.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Rest of you climbing along the mountain as well?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, is that the way in?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is there anything you can do to make the dragon visible with his invisibility? Set fire, or your faeries?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I do have Faerie Fire. You combine the two things that you said and it's fantastic.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll follow them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Everyone who's climbing, I need you to roll a strength check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait! Who's climbing where?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's no actual walkway to it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does anybody want to ride the broom with me?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll ride the broom. I'm not a climber.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: My Gloves of Swimming and Climbing, are those attuned items?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I don't think they are, no.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll put on my Gloves of Swimming and Climbing, which I got two years ago.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't know what they do.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Advantage on the roll.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, great! 16.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 16? Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 18. All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. And you're floating up?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All of you begin to shimmy across the surface. The wind is piercingly cold. The clouds up here are dark and there isn't enough moisture to rain, but there are flashes of some sort of wild lightning storm that go off in the distance in the roiling clouds. As you're making your way across, Pike, your foot skips across one of the stones, it breaks and falls beneath you and you almost lose yourself. Grog grabs you, and holds you in place, and pulls you back up.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Sorry, Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nobody saw anything.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I thought I would be stronger, but I'm still not.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You're a champ.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait! Aren't you wearing the strength gauntlets?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You all slowly make your way to the very mouth of the cavern. You've been at this point, as well. You wanted to go ahead and make an investigation?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Scootching in, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, go for it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 24. Feeling around the exterior, there are two rocks that are nearly identical, placed at each side of the cavern entrance. Upon approaching, their texture and their weathered appearance is far younger than the rest of the stone around them, and that catches your attention.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do I need a further investigation check to discern their nature?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The nature is some semblance of a magical enchantment. This is a little beyond your understanding unless you want to try and roughshod it in the way you know how.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Call me up to the front. We got this.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Scanlan, do you want to grab that big...

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Big what?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Shale.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, Shale.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And yourself.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You got a trap up there, friend?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Something. There's rocks up here that look a little funky and I don't think they actually are rocks.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Rocks? Hey Keyleth, you should go. There are rocks. You could do something with rocks--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I love rocks!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, I know. Go up there with Shale. Shale's a rock. Go.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. What's happening? Where am I?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Don't step on me.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh right! You're so tiny right now. I keep forgetting that.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: You're very brave for someone so small!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you want me to put you in a little pouch? Could be like a kangaroo?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're going to die!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Another time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As Keyleth and Shale approach the threshold that you're currently standing at, the rest of you are a little ways behind. He points out these two stones. Go ahead and both of you guys make an arcana check. Shale, just from what you've seen in the world.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Right. 13.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think like, seven. Pretty sure my arcana-- It's seven.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, druids. You ascertain, Shale, just from stumbling upon such constructions, this is-- There's some sort of magical essence to these rocks. It's old magic, which is the only reason you really recognize it. It's not the hoity-toity-learned-in-a-tower magic all the stupid people in the world tend to learn. This is

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You know what it is?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hey, dirty bard, could you come up here?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oi! I'm here now. Sorry. I thought that the rock people could handle it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All hands on deck.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Scanlan, it's a very pretty rock--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 11 on arcana.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's old magic.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Not the kind you learn in those hoity-toity towers.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What's going on down there? (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can't you just melt the rocks, Keyleth?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What does it look like?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It looks like a rock. Melt it!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No. What does it look like? Is it like a slate?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are two stones about three to four foot in diameter that are almost matching, that are younger, less weathered than the rest of the stonework around them.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Is there any way to circumvent them? Or are they in opposite sides?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're on opposite sides. You could circumvent them, they're not in your path.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can alter their shape. I can melt, I can do something with them.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No. Just, they're not real. A few steps back. Trickfoot's--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What do you mean, they're not real?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I walk up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can you dispel that shit?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yes. Is it magic--?

lines.name: SAM, CHRIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Not the kind of magic you learn in ivory towers.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Older-than-me magic.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It sort of has that old smell to it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hey, fuck it. I'm going to take a good, hard look at this rock.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hang on. We might be able to circumvent it. Right? Can we go around it?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I have Dispel Magic, but I wonder if we should use it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Dispel that magic!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: But that's one of my last spells!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well then, let's avoid them. Let's just go around them.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is there room on either side of them?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you could pass through them, over them, however else you want to try and circumvent them.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How about this? I'm going to cast Stoneshape, and can I carve out a little path around one of them, on the edge? Carve a little recess?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can, yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: See? Rocks! I told you!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Rocks!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Old rocks. Not the kind of rocks one finds in ivory towers.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes. Your 4th-level Stoneshape. You cause a portion of the rock wall at the side of the cavern to actually forge itself into a tunnel, circumventing the exterior rock on the left.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Could you just do that the entire way into the cavern?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can do it two more times. All the way into the cavern.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. Let's go through the new hole.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to go ahead and I'm going to keep doing the same. Come on, you big giant dummy.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm on a broom, do you want to ride it with me? Just kidding-- Percy's already on.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'll stealth ahead and look around.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So roll your stealth check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: A new stealth check?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, because you've come out of stealth and back into it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. Well, I still have Pass Without a Trace, right? So I'm at 40.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're actually able to start seeing--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Whoa! Slowly!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You people don't see shit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, that's acid!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: --in a raised platform, in a pool of somewhat pungent-smelling liquid as you get even remotely close to it, the fume causes your sinuses to open and burn and tingle.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: They barely get in.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. (cutesy voice) It's too small...

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm just going to hold still for a second and listen. Do I hear anything?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Breathing that is trying to stay quiet, but by the sheer immensity of the beast creating the sound, you can pick up the very subtle movement of air through the normally still cavern. (faint breathing noise)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to quietly take-- I'm going to back up 15 feet. (whispers) For everyone who's next to me, and for those who are not, it is in here. It is awake. And it is waiting for us.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: What did he say?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Pike. Don't. Move.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm so still.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Just coming running to go when shit goes down, but don't move.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (whispers) What about putting her on my back?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Grog, don't move yet. I'm going to go back in for another look.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Alone?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Stealth.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, yeah. I'm not a barbarian. I'm going to go along the edge closest to you and move back to where I stopped to listen.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: About there would be in tandem with where you were.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And I'm going to go another ten feet in, looking.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As he curls back, the cavern is revealed further. The pool does come to an end. There are pieces of stone that jut out of the floor. You do see now, scattered across the grounds, occasionally a bit of shine, a little coin-- gold, silver-- elements of wealth that've been dragged deeper into the cavern that have left behind them some remnants in the process of being carried and carted in.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: If I look back, can I see my sister from where I am?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Actually, no. Because she's really well stealthed.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She can't see me either?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No. You guys have no visual perspective on each other. You've all stealthed away from your own party.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. There's a pool of acid right by me, yeah?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, there is.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is there dim light here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The light grows dim at about this point, then it becomes darkness at about this point.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But you said that I can see a pool of liquid, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. What little bit of daylight that's coming in the cavern entrance would be over here.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is the surface of the liquid flat as far as I can see?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What you can see, it is flat. There's a little, very faint breeze that occasionally comes through so there's a slight disturbance here and there, but no specific visual disturbance.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How far along that pool can I actually see? If you had to do a cut-off point?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Because of your darkvision, being an elf, you can see pretty much to the edge of this.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. So it doesn't look like there's a big divot?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's no displacement of the pool.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to creep along the wall towards that pillar. I'll stop in that corner, and then move towards you one. Does it give me a better view?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A little bit of a further view, just the cavern continues in that direction.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can I still hear the same thing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can hear it very faintly. You can't quite make out the source. There is something about the room and the air that's travelling through here. The sound itself, you're just barely catching it and it seems to be reverberating to a small extent off the walls of this cavern, which carry sound very well.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What do I see if I look up?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You look up, you see about 60 feet, 70 feet in the air, just past where your vision begins to fade-- The only reason you know there's a ceiling there is because there are a few points of rock, the top of the cavern does descend into stalactites-- it is?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Stalactites, yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes. Thank you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There's no large outcrops that this thing could be sitting on?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not from what you can see, no. The mineral build-up of the inside of this cavern leads to a direct, slick surface in the walls. The minerals rounded off most of the stone.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The best thing that I can do right now is take it unawares, hurt it for as much as I can--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are you kidding me right now?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm not kidding you! I want to kill this thing. This is the first stepping stone, and I could potentially take it out. Catch it unawares before it vomits on all of you. I want to do it, and I just want to know that you're going to come in after and finish it if you need to. I told you what I want to do.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right. I will give you a minute head start to get across the room. After that, I'm coming in. So you better hope you're at the dragon by that point.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I start off. Come back and tug. (whispers) Jenga.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a stealth check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going back to where I was.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. What is it?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: With Pass Without a Trace? 43.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The rest of you, what are you doing?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Well, he's a mad little one, isn't he?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'd like to go around the column, and around the edge of the wall.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This opens up slightly more, and you get to see a portion of the mineral growth-- a lot of the moisture that has coalesced into the ceiling has come into a central point, and over time, it just built up these central columns of rock and natural materials. A few pools have gathered towards the base. You see portions of the ground where elements of the acrid liquid that filled the pool over here just dripped in. Whether they began this way or turned by the dragon's presence, you are unaware. But that's as far as you can see.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Further along the wall, that little rock-- yeah. And just a little bit past it. And then closer to you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point, you can make out that additional pool of acid, the far back corner and a risen platform, you see the portion of the cavernous stone beginning to mass into a higher level towards the far back corner.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I listen.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll a perception check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 20. You listen in... Silence. Stillness. The very faint whisper of wind far behind you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Around the entire wall. Further, past that pool of acid, even. Further corner.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Has it been a minute yet?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: About half a minute.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your shoulder hits something.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Stab.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll initiative.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'll take it, that means 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So you have just bumped into the currently invisible form of Umbrasyl lying in wait in the far corner of the cavern. That would be a 20 initiative from Umbrasyl.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Fuck. You.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How long has it been?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this travel pace, it's been about 45 seconds or so.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Jenga! (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You hear "Jenga!" out of the back of the earring as, let's say the rest of you guys are right here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I still want to be stealthed on the broom but I take off into the cavern.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I assume Trinket is in your necklace?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. This is going to be you, with your big stick.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Awesome!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Chilling here with the rest of the party. So, at the top of this round, you just hear the growl, the snarl. (snarling) You say "Jenga," blades already at the ready, you go to stab as (swooshing) all of a sudden, you hear this swishing sound of air being cut through at such a speed that it causes a high-pitched whine. Claws and teeth come spinning out of nowhere. You can't even see your attacker but you feel the brunt force behind each of these blows.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Because it's invisible, is there no Uncanny Dodge?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, you've still got Uncanny Dodge on one of the attacks. Just from your roguish instincts.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Displacer Cloak.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct. It gets disadvantage on the first attack, which is going to be a bite. That's a natural 19, and a two! With the two, that brings it to a 17.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Nope.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So with that, you (whoosh) see for a split second, the ripple of teeth snap before you, missing your face by mere inches before they disappear once again. Two more claws (whoosh) towards you. The first one, that's a 19 again and a seven. That's going to be a 22.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Just hits. Uncanny Dodge.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, your AC would be 20 because you're not hasted right now.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, you're right. Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So that would put you at 18 points of slashing damage.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Halved to nine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Halved to nine. Also your displacement is gone from your cloak.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: For this round?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. For the next attack, it's a 19. Misses you? 20? Yeah. The second claw swings through, at this point, from the pain of the first strike of the dragon claw hits you, you back up to the very edge of the cave and duck out of the way as you hear the wind change. As you do, you hear the stone crash behind you as the claw misses you, slamming instead to the side of the cavern wall. It's now your turn.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to stay right here. I'm going to hold my turn until one of my friends is on top of this thing and then I'm going to stab it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You hold your action until one of your friends is on it and then you move? Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Melee attack.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So that ends your turn. Everyone else, I need you to roll initiative.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, shitballs!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Balls of shit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Whoa! Percy!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your initiative from before was--?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So 25 to 20?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He rolled a natural 20!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) Percy!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are you on the broom with me still?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah. I'm hanging so I can drop.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So that's 20. 20 to 15?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Another 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Another 19! Nice!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Nice, Pike!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So Pike then Keyleth.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: A mere 16.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Scanlan, what did you get? (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I got an eight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys hear the crashing of stone at the far corner accompanied directly after the whisper of Vax's cry-out of "Jenga!" you already know shit is going down. Percy, you're up first. Clutching the bottom of the broom that has not moved yet, what are you doing with your turn?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to drop down. I'll let go of the broom. I'm going to just fire blind where I heard the noise coming from.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you're firing in this direction?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make your attacks at disadvantage.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Disadvantage. That is a 25.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Due to the massive size of this currently still invisible entity, you do manage to catch an odd bullet towards its form. Go ahead and roll damage.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh my god. Ten points of piercing damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty. (gunshot sound) Gun goes off, echoes, little bit of dust comes loose from the ceiling and falls down as you ready for your next shot.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Might as well go for it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At disadvantage.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This time, the shot goes the second time (gunshot sound) poofs against some stone in the distance, not hitting its mark.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Third shot for the run. Fucking--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Natural 20.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And a one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So with that, the third shot (click), nothing emerges from it. And you look down. It's not been a day for Percy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's not been a day for Percy. I'm going to start making a dash into the corner there, up in the--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not a dash, because you used your action.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, I'll make a run. Yes, to the wall.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Is that some sort of weapon?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Not anymore, it's not!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As she takes her one good arm and cleans out, missing an eye now or maybe missing an eardrum. (laughs) That's going to end your turn, Percy?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh god, this is a terrible idea. I'm going to roll and hide behind that pillar behind me. If that's okay?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This one, right here?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah. I've got to fix this.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That brings us to Vex.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes. I'm going to fly on my broom as far in as I can. And land, maybe on that? And just shoot arrows towards where I heard it coming from. I feel like I have one blazing bowstring left, because I used it once in the last battle, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You would still have one more use, yes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. Then I'm going to try it through the blazing bowstring.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it. At disadvantage on this shot, as you cannot see the actual entity. You're firing into the darkness.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Natural 20. And another natural 20?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Piece of shit! 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 19? Nope!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh! War God's Blessing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As your reaction, you guide her-- though the blazing bowstring was unfortunately used on the first attack that missed.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That was just for the first attack. I rolled twice for disadvantage. So that's the blazing bowstring.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, I misunderstood. As you go for the attack, you see the actual arrow bursting into flames, not quite sure where to fire. You're about to pull back and aim and Pike shouts to you, putting her hand out. Suddenly, a spark of divine energy hits the front of the bow and corrects its course, beyond your actual arm motion, and you release, based on the faith you have in Pike. The arrow strikes true. You hear a slight growling roar from the distance. Go ahead and roll damage.

lines.name: PIKE
lines.text: Strike good and true!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 22, nice.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: On my first attack! If I release Trinket, is that an attack? Or is that a bonus action?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It would say in the actual item.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Raven's Slumber. You can make a melee attack. No, that's not it. Bonus action to release it! I'm going to use a bonus action, and I'm going to shout at Trinket to go run towards my brother. I'm going to attack it again.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Trinket is going to go-- it's 40 feet, right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Trinket rushes forward there. You go make your second attack. Trinket goes: (angry bear growls) big old grizzly bear charging into the darkness, growling echoing through the cavern.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, disadvantage. 27.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 27 with disadvantage still hits, yeah. Your honed senses to dragon-kind, you can remember the mass, and general size and placement based on the sound you heard from the growls from the first impact you made. You just strike again in the same direction, hitting true. Roll damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 12 damage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is that sneak attack because my brother is next to it?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's occupied with me.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So I would have gotten the sneak attack on both those? Or just on the one?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Just on the one. Yes, I'll allow it because he is currently threatening it. It was a lucky shot. It was a very lucky shot.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Additional five.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty, good to know. So, total of--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 17. Thank you. Both arrows done. Trinket rushing in--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I want to duck down if I can, behind that whatever that I'm standing on now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can duck down, but you've used most of your action in this turn to sail in, and you can't hide per se.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. I just want to duck behind it so I'm away from anything flying at me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Makes sense. All right, so we're now at 20. At this point in time, the roar hits (roaring), echoing through the cavern. As the echoing begins to vibrate and the noise doesn't subside, the low hum turns instead to a (buzzing) as seemingly out of the pool of acid, a cloud of biting, stinging insects emerges.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He did Insect Plague.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (buzzing) Floats in this direction, getting the three of you right there. I'll say for the purposes of this that you guys are both in that radius. Anyway, this cloud of insects moves in to-- I need Percy, Shale, and Vex to make constitution saving throws.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Aw, eight!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 18. So you guys both, being dexterous and quick, but also able to maintain your form-- the best you can at this turn-- manage to pull out of the way without too much impact. However, poor Shale is surrounded by the insects.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Slow and half-deaf.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You take 12 points of piercing damage as the insects riddle you with bites and stings.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Shale, do you have any gold teeth or hidden savings accounts that we should also know about?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: She can't hear you, she's deaf.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point now, you hear a few footfalls, Vax. You see a splash in the pool next to you that almost scatters against you, bits of it hitting the edge of your armor, but the armor absorbs the blow, being attuned towards acid resistance. A few other steps as it begins to walk away. I'll allow you to make an attack of opportunity with disadvantage--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: With disadvantage, but-- Yeah, okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, as you sense that it's moving away, you wildly swing out in front of you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Nah. 15.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15. Whiffs on air. However, (heavy footfalls) moving forward. A voice comes roaring out into the area, "You dare soil my home after what you've done below?! I will watch you dissolve "before I suck down your liquid forms!" I need Vex, Pike, Keyleth, Scanlan, and Percy to all make dexterity saving throws.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do I not have cover?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not enough to prevent this. It's a lobbed stream of liquid acid that comes and surrounds, corroding.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do we get advantage on any of it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not unless you have something that gives you advantage on him.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm spending a Resolve because that was bullshit. Can I burn another Resolve? Goddamn it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nope. All right, so.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can I use Cutting Words to buff my roll?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You use Cutting Words to reduce the damage.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But not to-- That seems right, yeah. All right. 18.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 18, all right. Hold on, I'll just double-check while you're saying this. Just to bring up the ability.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I should know this.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It would have to be a damage roll, because there's no attack roll. There's no other roll incorporated on this other than the damage roll.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Got it. It just happens.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right. But it reduces the damage roll, which affects everybody.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Wait! I think I cast Resistance. I cast it on Keyleth, I cast it on--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Me. And I think you cast it on Scanlan.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's faded since it's a concentration spell.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Scanlan's got the armor.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. If you were to use Cutting Words on this, it would reduce the damage all of you would take from it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, I will use Cutting Words to reduce the damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What are your cutting words, Scanlan?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: My cutting words are, "Your lower intestine smells like shit!" (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and roll your bardic inspiration die.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: A ten? Shit roll. Three!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So 18 saving throw. What was yours?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Keyleth?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Vex? One. Pike?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Seven.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Seven. Okay, reduced by three, you all suffer 47 points of acid damage.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Including me, with my acid armor?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You take half of that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Aren't you glad I gave you the armor?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You take 23 points of acid damage. After its long, angry, boastful diatribe, as it rears back to blow, your words confuse it, and the spray seems a little off-center than what it intended. However, most of you are now currently dealing with the searing pain of the acid pressed against your bodies. Ending that turn, Vax, you're up.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Did I see where the ejection of acid came out from?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You did. It came from there, this area.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Am I still at a disadvantage even though I saw right where that crap came out?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You just know it's somewhere in that vicinity.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to throw two daggers at it. I hope that Trinket's near it, but we'll see. So, at disadvantage. Bollocks! That's 15.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nope.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 22 just hits. Trinket, however, is actually adjacent to Umbrasyl. So you could do sneak attack damage.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Whoa! What's up?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Keen Dagger. It's 26.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 26. All right. So one dagger just vanishes into the darkness. The other one sticks into the hide for a second before disappearing in a plume of smoke, reappearing at the side of your belt. You hear a low (snarling grunt).

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can I use my movement to go along the back edge of the cave as far as I can? Directly opposite from my family.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Looking at the rest of this cavern--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Look at all the gold, hiding over there!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is what seems to be the majority of the funds that were gathered from Westruun, and whatever else of the previous dragon's hoard have currently been brought over to the new lair. Who knows how much has been--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I thought that was his magic healing spot, but I guessed wrong.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, that end your turn?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Now it comes to Shale.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: I'm with insects, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You are currently surrounded by stinging, biting insects.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Okay. I will stride forth. I'm slow and old. I move 20, so I'll use all my movement, 40, to advance.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you go. You come pushing through, brushing them off with your stump and your staff, waving it in front. Angrily growling, you come to rest at the side of this one pillar that juts out of the ground, with Vex right above you.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: I'll dimly look into the darkness and see if I can see, hear, or there's just gray mist in front of my eyes right now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see elements and flashes of the bear that you saw Vex summon forth from her throat.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And the dagger disappeared into something, right?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: All right. But I can't hear the dragon? At all? It's stomping around.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's stomping around a little bit. You saw where the actual projectile came from, so you know it's somewhere in this vicinity.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Well, that would be a nine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Survival and victory mean

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Oh, shut up, you flying suitcase!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And that's how you end a round. Pike, you're up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So good.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah. I'm going to hold my action and I'm going to backpack onto Grog.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So you move over and leap up onto Grog's back, holding tightly. What's the trigger for your action that you're holding?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: On his next attack on somebody.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The next time you sense the dragon is attacking somebody?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. What action are you holding? Is it a spell?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you begin preparing the spell. You are now concentrating on it, as you're holding the back of Grog. Okay. Holding that bit, that brings us to Keyleth. What are you doing?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: If I move through Insect Plague, will I take damage? Or is it if I end in it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You don't know.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: I seemed to waltz through it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's true. You waltzed through it. And you didn't start in it, did you?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: I did.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh. But you took the damage up top, you didn't take damage again after you got out of it. All right. I want to see if I can move. I'm having a hard time seeing, Matt. Can I get my full movement of 30 feet into this corner here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Over here?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That way is going to require a climb check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh really, I can parkour it? Yeah!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, go ahead and make a strength check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, it's not too hard. You ran up, grab, leap over the side. You can get right there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, okay. I think the dragon is roughly here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: In this vicinity. You can see Trinket is currently snarling and lashing out and biting in this area of the cavern.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm really sorry, Grog. I'm going to cast Faerie Fire, roughly-- Yeah, somewhere where I think he is.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Why is that bad?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Means you don't have acid resistance anymore. It's a concentration spell. But none of us can see him, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty. So, Faerie Fire. You guys watch as suddenly, this burst of somewhat violet-ish blue light, like a small, tiny explosion of glitter and starlight just hits the area and outlines the entirety of the large dragon Umbrasyl.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And with my bonus action--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, failed saving throw.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Damn right, he did. With my bonus action, I'm going to go into my--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Actually, you know what?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He's going to do his thing, isn't he?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You know, you don't need to.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, I do. Third and final legendary resistance. You get a glimpse of where Umbrasyl is and then the magic dissipates. Umbrasyl vanishes from sight.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Shit.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You've burned his third legendary action. You've burned it. It's gone.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Matt, did it also negate my disadvantage from Cutting Words, on the save?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He can succeed automatically. It's a choice to succeed.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Balls. So that's dead, too?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nope.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Does he use the legendary action before he fails?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No. That's true. Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So it kills that too?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It does, yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nice. No, my thing's dead too. He double-fucked us.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Great. Fuck you, asshole!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He doesn't save it like that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And then decided to succeed using legendary resistance.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. But it's gone! They're gone.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: They're gone,

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As far as you know, from previous experience with dragons, there are no further uses of its legendary resistance.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What a dick.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Does that end your turn, Keyleth? It's a level one spell, you still have more up your sleeves if you wanted to try it later.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I know. I don't think I'm going to go into my beast shape form so I can do another spell next turn. Can I just tuck and see if I could take a bonus action to hide in this little nook and cranny here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can't use a bonus action to hide, unfortunately.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Because I'm not a rogue?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Because you're not a rogue. Sorry, girl.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I hug that pillar and say, (panting)?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At the end of Keyleth's turn, it's going to use two of its legendary actions to wing attack. It's going to beat its wings, everything within 15 feet, which right now would only be Trinket, has to go ahead and succeed on a dexterity saving throw. Go ahead and roll a dexterity saving throw for Trinket.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to roll the brown dice for Trinket. Dexterity? 12.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 12. Okay. So Trinket takes 15 points of bludgeoning damage--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's resistant to bludgeoning!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Because of the armor?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I've got a lot to concentrate on.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: When I die, I'm coming back as a character named Vix.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so that ends Keyleth's turn. Grog, you're up.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I take the tiny Pike backpack, and I would like to run along the right, the farther wall from you. Opposite direction.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This way?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: 50 feet, using diagonals to try and get as far around that pool as I can.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's about as far as you can get there. So that's movement with Pike on your back. So, that's your movement?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yep. And I'll use my bonus action to go into a rage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. (growling)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hey Pike, gimme a slap!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (slap)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (growls)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sends you into the rage. You still have your action. Anything you want to do?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nope.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Are you holding your action for any particular thing?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, I can't really hit him from here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. That ends Grog's turn. Scanlan, you're up.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I can't see him, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not from what you can tell, no.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Balls. I can see Vex, right? And Shale? Oh, shit. I can't do much without seeing him. Oh, here's what I will do: I'll start by inspiring Shale. I will just step out and sing, (singing) And I will always buff you! And then I will pick a place and cast Stinking Cloud.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You take your d10 inspiration die.

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Excellent.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And Stinking Cloud. Haven't seen that in a while.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No! Oh well, it's too late, I already said it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Stinking Cloud. Where are you setting it?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can I have a pointer? Well, I'll just come over. Right here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Three plus 14, that's a 17. What's the DC?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. The cloud appears in this space. You can already hear (coughing). Are you going to move or stay where you are?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There's no more cloud of insects, yeah?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's still in this vicinity.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is there any way to avoid it? Move up to where Kiki is or anything?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, if you want to make a strength check to climb.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, I'll do that. I'll move up to where Kiki is. 17.

lines.name: MATT
